headline: Michael Burry’s Scion Hedge Fund Deregistered, SEC Filing Shows
summary: The change took place on Nov. 10, according to a filing on the SEC website.  Burry, who rose to fame for his 2008 bet against the US housing market, said in a social media post featuring a screenshot of the terminated status that he was “on to much better things Nov 25th.”  Scion Asset Management did not immediately return requests for comment.

headline: Michael Burry’s Scion Fund Is Deregistered, SEC Filing Shows
summary: The change took place on Nov. 10, according to a filing on the SEC website.  Burry, who rose to fame for his 2008 bet against the US housing market, said in a social media post featuring a screenshot of the terminated status that he was “on to much better things Nov 25th.”  The hedge fund manager has previously warned about market exuberance, last month posting an image of his character from  movie and a warning that “sometimes, we see bubbles.”

headline: US stocks drop as Nvidia and AI superstars keep weakening
summary: The U.S. stock market is slumping on Thursday as Nvidia and other superstars swept up in the mania around artificial-intelligence technology keep weakening.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 363 points, or 0.8%, from its own record set the day before, while the Nasdaq composite was down 1.7%, as of 11:15 a.m. Eastern time.  Nvidia was the heaviest weight on the market after the chip company lost 3.8%.

content.title: US stocks drop as Nvidia and AI superstars keep weakening
content.summary: The U.S. stock market is slumping on Thursday as Nvidia and other superstars swept up in the mania around artificial-intelligence technology keep weakening.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 363 points, or 0.8%, from its own record set the day before, while the Nasdaq composite was down 1.7%, as of 11:15 a.m. Eastern time.  Nvidia was the heaviest weight on the market after the chip company lost 3.8%.

headline: Wall Street drops toward its worst day in a month as AI superstars keep weakening
summary: The U.S. stock market is tumbling toward one of its worst days since its springtime sell-off, as Nvidia and other AI superstar stocks keep dropping Thursday on worries their prices shot too high.  Wall Street is also questioning whether the coming cuts to interest rates that it’s been banking on will actually happen.  It’s on track for its worst day in a month and its second-worst since plunging in April after President Donald Trump shocked the world with his announcement of “Liberation Day” tariffs.

content.title: Wall Street drops toward its worst day in a month as AI superstars keep weakening
content.summary: The U.S. stock market is tumbling toward one of its worst days since its springtime sell-off, as Nvidia and other AI superstar stocks keep dropping Thursday on worries their prices shot too high.  Wall Street is also questioning whether the coming cuts to interest rates that it’s been banking on will actually happen.  It’s on track for its worst day in a month and its second-worst since plunging in April after President Donald Trump shocked the world with his announcement of “Liberation Day” tariffs.

headline: How to build a winning portfolio like a pro
summary: Worried this AI-fueled rally is a bubble waiting to pop? On Trading Pit, Stocks in Translation host Jared Blikre and Trader Talk host Kenny Polcari break down how pros really manage risk, from matching your timeframe and goals to using the S&P 500 (^GSPC) as a core benchmark. They walk through sector rotations in healthcare and utilities, show why charts flagged Lululemon (LULU) and Palantir (PLTR) as “priced for perfection,” and explain the volatility trade-off in names like IonQ (IONQ) versus broader tech ETFs. You’ll learn how to avoid accidental overexposure to giants like Apple (AAPL), use basic technicals and P/E ratios, and keep emotions in check as you build a portfolio that can survive the next round of market turbulence. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

content.title: How to build a winning portfolio like a pro
content.description:
Worried this AI-fueled rally is a bubble waiting to pop? On Trading Pit, Stocks in Translation host Jared Blikre and Trader Talk host Kenny Polcari break down how pros really manage risk, from matching your timeframe and goals to using the S&P 500 (^GSPC) as a core benchmark. They walk through sector rotations in healthcare and utilities, show why charts flagged Lululemon (LULU) and Palantir (PLTR) as “priced for perfection,” and explain the volatility trade-off in names like IonQ (IONQ) versus broader tech ETFs. You’ll learn how to avoid accidental overexposure to giants like Apple (AAPL), use basic technicals and P/E ratios, and keep emotions in check as you build a portfolio that can survive the next round of market turbulence.

For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

They walk through sector rotations in healthcare and utilities, show why charts flagged Lululemon (LULU) and Palantir (PLTR) as “priced for perfection,” and explain the volatility trade-off in names like IonQ (IONQ) versus broader tech ETFs. headline: Red Cat Holdings Reports Q3 2025 Revenue Growth of 646% Y/Y Sequential Quarterly Revenue Growth of 200%; Guides Q4 Revenue to 1455% Y/Y; FY 2025 Revenue Guidance to 124% Y/Y, Beating Q3 Revenue Consensus Expectations
summary: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Nov. 13, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Red Cat Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: RCAT) ("Red Cat" or the "Company"), a U.S.-based provider of advanced all-domain drone and robotic solutions for defense and national security, reports its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. Business and Financial Highlights Q3 quarterly revenue grew 646% year over year and 200% over the prior quarter to $9.6 million, beating consensus expectations.Update on the U.S. Army’s SRR
